alert.note: Alert for Harding; Perkins; Ziebach (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 27 at 8:06AM MST until December 27 at 12:00PM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...VERY COLD WIND CHILLS THIS MORNING ACROSS NORTHWEST SOUTH DAKOTA... .Winds have decreased this morning, and blowing snow has also decreased. However, wind chills of 25 below to 35 below zero will continue across Harding, Perkins, and Zeibach counties in northwest South Dakota. ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST TODAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Harding County, Perkins County and Ziebach County. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Cheyenne River Reservation. * WHEN...Until noon MST today. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: A wind chill advisory means the combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. If you go outside, cover all parts of your body, especially your head, face, and hands.
